review_title: Easiest job I have ever had.... as a Paramedic
pros:
I have worked across the country as a paramedic and have over 25 years in the EMS arena. JFK is one of the better employers I have ever had.  If you don't like field supervisors breathing down your neck while you take care of patients then JFK is the place for you.  Management leaves you alone to do your job and  that is the bottom line. If you are a good paramedic you are left to your duties with minimal oversight. The pay is really really really good.  The system is busy and new paramedics and EMT's will benefit from the high acuity  and level of autonomy that is allowed in the field. 

I want to leave the reader with this: If you are a patient advocate JFK is where you want to work.  Management will stand behind you  100% of the time  as long as you have the patient's best interest in your treatment plan and you do no harm.
cons: The benefits  package is less than desirable that is why the pay is so high. The EMS  IT system seems to fail frequently creating charting delays that become super aggravating at times.  Sometime we have too much technology to deal with. The paramedic quarters are archaic at best  and EMT's street post -  two words "system status"   posting.

job_title: Senior Certified Pharmacy Technician in Edison, NJ
pros:
Great place to work, great staff, flexible scheduling. I would recommend to a friend. Benefits are amazing!

Rewarding and satisfying career working in a hospital
Having a positive impact on patients' lives
Job stability, which is not impacted by a recession
Working in a team environment with other healthcare workers, including MDs, phlebotomists, respiratory therapists, and more
Good salary, which is dependent upon the specific facility and job title. Hospital nurses usually earn a higher salary than in a private office or other ancillary facility
Healthcare benefits are usually offered, based on the individual facility
Stimulating environment, which is non-stop, around-the-clock
cons:
Exposure to germs being around many sick people
Sometimes the parking options are competitive, especially in large urban areas. Staff is usually offered satellite parking because patient-only parking is often adjacent to the hospital
Frustration when patients do not get better. It is difficult to watch patients struggle or die in the hospital
Hospital work requires 24/7/365 coverage, which includes weekends and holidays, not typical “office hours.” The expansive hours must be fully covered in order to deliver safe and efficient patient care throughout the hospital
Exposure to unruly patients (anger, intoxication, belligerent, loud, physically reactive) in the workplace can create a difficult environment
The unknown factor about what or who will be a patient can make some jobs unpredictable, which can increase the stress factor

pros: Considering it is still a smaller community medical center, JFKMC has a lot going for it. They are always trying to improve quality while advancing. In general it is easy to make friends with colleagues. There are also many opportunities to move within the hospital for career advancement. There are nice little treats (parties, bonuses, etc..) for hospital anniversaries and also when a unit makes an accomplishment.
cons: With the exception of neuroscience, there is a limited array of treatment/employment options given the smaller size of the hospital. However, there is a considerable amount of expansion occurring.

pros: Pay is competitive and it's a fairly busy department with a fine mixture of medical/trauma 911s as well as non-emergent transports.
cons: If you're not a management favorite, you're invisible. They will change your shift without notification and penalize you for it. They favor brown nosing over actual talent. There are EMTs on the road that I feel are unsafe, and some medics are rather incompetent, but any complaints about co-workers or management just puts a target on your back rather then someone actually caring and trying to remedy the situation. No one cares and it's a shame. All of our management is coming over from RWJ...the same people that sink their EMS department are sinking ours...

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Edison, NJ
pros: I haven't been working here for long, but so far, I'm satisfied with my experience at JFK. Their staff members are understanding,  fun and friendly to work with. If you are a student, they understand that college is important and they work out your schedule according to it, which is something i really appreciate about them.  Their HR department is very helpful. I had many issues with my paper work when i had applied for the position. But they were really patient, and helped and guided me through it. All in all, my experience at JFK is the best.
cons: I wish their benefits were a little more better.

pros: Great, mostly caring people.  Lots of opportunity to help others and grow within the organization. Lots of opportunity for innovation and
cons: Some employees can still improve in their work ethics. Difficult to get rid of poor performers, who often are very toxic for the organization or the department they are in.

review_title: Good pay and benefits, a lot asked of you
pros: Good pay and guaranteed 40 hours a week. Excellent benefits, especially now as a part of Hackensack meridian health. Overtime almost always available.
cons:
You are expected to be available to work anytime they need you, which is to be expected with this type of facility. Last minute needs for overtime might put you in a tight spot for personal plans. Old equipment breaking is a common problem. 

Short staffed and lots of work.

pros: Local, stable, continuity. The culture is long standing. Because of this you either will fit right in or need to move on just as quickly.
cons: I think that a select group is "looked after" and it can be difficult to voice an opinion if it goes against the "norms" of a particular department.
